image_by: Photo by Edgar Castrejon on Unsplash
thought: A meat lovers carbon dioxide footprint is approximately the double of a vegetarian diet, so try to think about that when you plan your menu.

header: Buy quality - it will last longer
image_by: Photo by Irene Kredenets on Unsplash
thought: Some things to think about: Is it a good blend, does it feel good to touch, does is smell good, will you use it again?

title: Take a happy planet photo!
image_by: Photo by Alfian Danial on Unsplash
thought: Remember nice and valuable places. Keep them in mind and as photos to embrace.

image_by: Photo by Sergei Akulich on Unsplash
thought: Trees has been around for long, say hello, get to know a tree and be connected with nature.

image_by: Photo by Edson Rosas on Unsplash
thought: Reuse water on a plant: You can save water and energy by thinking of how to recycle water in your home.

title: Plan this weekâ€™s shopping
image_by: Photo by Alfred Kenneally on Unsplash
thought: If you plan what to buy you will buy less spontanous and with more concern of what you buy.

image_by: Photo by Maurice Smeets on Unsplash
thought: Enjoy your bike ride. Get efficient and save time by stopping by a nice place on your way home.

title: Pick up plastic at the beach!
image_by: Photo by Tobias Tullius on Unsplash
thought: Help protect the sea and its biosphere, as all the living organisms have traces of plastic in the food chains. Help stop that!

image_by: Photo by Holger Link on Unsplash
thought: Cet into the cirkular economy - Buy recycled - Recycle buyed - Repeat

header: Borrow a nice dress of a friend!
image_by: Photo by Zhong Liguo on Unsplash
thought: It is a good practice to think that you can use a dress several times. Borrow the dress and it will be worn a nother time. That is the trick to decrease the impact of each clothes. Use it several times

image_by: Photo by Alicia Petresc on Unsplash
thought: If you were to buy jeans and they were heavier, they would definitely be more durable, says Sean Cormier, a professor at the Fashion Institute of Technology.

image_by: Photo by Jon Tyson on Unsplash
thought: 'The concept of biosphere stewardship directs attention to human-nature relationships that generate positive outcomes for biodiversity and ecosystem services, emphasizing notions of care, learning and collaboration.'

title: Play with your last idea!
image_by: Photo by Hipster Mum on Unsplash
thought: It is so much fun to get a new idea from a new way of doing something

image_by: Photo by Matteo Paganelli on Unsplash
thought: How would you do this everyday thing if you did it in a completely different way.

image_by: Photo by Jasmin Sessler on Unsplash
thought: Recycle the smallest items as well. It is very satisfaying to do things well.

title: Test drive another car
image_by: Photo by Olena Sergienko on Unsplash
thought: A smaller, a different energy source, in shared use - there are many ways of having a car now adays.

header: Grow up and be aware of the planet!
image_by: Photo by Mark Asthoff on Unsplash
thought: Cigarette butts from grown ups are the most common form of marine litter - that is so up-side-down - so you almost can laugh. Just do anything to stop this stupidness!

image_by: Photo by Birmingham Museums Trust on Unsplash
thought: It can give you a valuable memory if you use a thing for long.

image_by: Photo by Caju Gomes on Unsplash
thought: Move your body, take the bike, use your legs to run and your body to play. Eat what is good for you!

header: Yum, yum - Cook something new of the left overs!
image_by: Photo by Edgar Castrejon on Unsplash
thought: Do it easy. let everybody select what they want from the left-overs. Just add some pita-bread!

header: Check if a new thing has been travelling long distance to get to you?
image_by: Photo by Guillaume Bolduc on Unsplash
thought: Jump on the challenge to see where your stuff is from. Take contact with your favourite shop and ask for alternatives.

title: Where to go next?
image_by: Photo by Vinicius LÃ¶w on Unsplash
thought: Home, far away, into the fanatasy, to the forrest, to relatives, to your dream destination. Have a nice trip!

title: Give somebody else the things you don't use!
image_by: Photo by Alexandra Gorn on Unsplash
thought: It is very nice to give and to get!

header: Think together and share a good idea!
image_by: Photo by Romnw on Unsplash
thought: You say one thing and your friend comes up with next part and the whole is greater than the separate parts.

header: Fix a hole in a sock!
image_by: Photo by Les Triconautes on Unsplash
thought: Can yo still do it? You need a needle and a thread and about ten minutes. Search youtube if you have forgotten how to do it.

image_by: Photo by Sebastian Pichler on Unsplash
thought: The idea is that planet stewardship feels great and is necessesary for our future on earth.

title: Become a biosphere steward
image_by: Photo by Matt Gross on Unsplash
thought: Take care of the earth you live on. Feel that you are part of something bigger buy doing small good things.

image_by: Photo by Apaha Spi on Unsplash
thought: Do different - remove something instead of adding

image_by: Photo by Mark LYU on Unsplash
thought: We are creative people that have been evolving since the first human Lucy lived on Earth 3 miljon years ago.

image_by: Photo by Jon Tyson on Unsplash
thought: Remember that you are great and that everybody can do something.
